tweets.text:
There are #FloodWarnings in place across England.  

Check your flood risk: https://t.co/BpUpnjiX4L 

#Flooding https://t.co/FUlxnBB6Nq
@TonyJuniper Good to see this visit but surely the local water company @AffinityWater, farmers and @EnvAgency have been aware of the destruction going on here for years?

Thanks everyone for such an informative visit to the River Chess. Major challenges in getting chalk rivers into good shape. Partnerships clearly vital in dealing with the wide range of pressures at hand, including water demand, runoff from farms & roads & river channel health. https://t.co/oaLku1I4jr

tweets.text: Bulgaria is accused of burning waste illegally in coal fired power stations. Bulgaria has no EfW facilities never mind R1 rated facilities. I asked via FOI where this waste went. I received this. @EnvAgency you will not stop the illegal export of waste by helping to cover it up. https://t.co/fDvMhlhHsj https://t.co/RswygwDEqh
FTAO @EnvAgency https://t.co/LS3atsPuu3
Heavy rain across the South West is expected to impact some roads. Take care and never drive through flood water. https://t.co/XoURKx3zxw
And just when you think things can’t get any worse....when will the flood defence be going up @EnvAgencySW @ExeterCouncil? https://t.co/gaGjnYxXqQ

Getting ready to roll again.... a second day of high flow gaugings for @EnvAgencySW . Red text is sites that require gauging to calibrate the flow record- essential for #floodwarning and #forecasting https://t.co/R7G4Lcyh6H

We’re putting up flood barriers today in Frankwell (#Shrewsbury), #Hereford and #Bewdley. Are you #floodaware ? Sign up for alerts here 
https://t.co/hquuoBs8hF https://t.co/plRYE9aMbU

Flooding can happen at any time.
 
This festive period, check out four things you can do to protect yourself, your family, and your home.
 
 👉https://t.co/PzDbHFZ82f
 
 #PrepareActSurvive https://t.co/2FDmubSMLz

There are #FloodWarnings in place across England.  

Check your flood risk: https://t.co/BpUpnjiX4L 

#Flooding https://t.co/FUlxnBB6Nq
We're taking reports of environmental damage to the #SSSI at the #RiverLugg very seriously, and are working with @EnvAgency and @ForestryComm to take immediate action. https://t.co/27DINp3vD7

@WGHaggerston @gideoncorby @Feargal_Sharkey @hackneycouncil @AECOM @WildLondon @mayorofhackney @jonburkeUK @EnvAgency @CanalRiverTrust That’s the plan, Thames Water will be contacted also. The water quality of most of London’s canals and tributaries is truly terrible... the number of misconnections staggering

Following persistent rain over the last few days, there a number of @NatResWales and @EnvAgency #flood warnings in force this morning.

Latest details: https://t.co/0faAzbKIQV

Matt https://t.co/Wws6nMc8vn
@StGeorgesTrust1 We reached a position sometime ago that the @EnvAgency are a part of the problem not the solution. I’ve said it before, they have absolutely no credibility left in this conversation.

Out in #Warwick, #Leamington & #Rugby today with Rich & Adam clearing screens and checking hotspot areas ahead of the forecasted rain over the next few days. We’ve also managed to do some #wildlife spotting at Mill Bridge in Leamington @EnvAgencyMids @Warwick_DC @rugbybc https://t.co/hnows0siUe

tweets.text:
Just received this from @EnvAgency

"...current levels of abstraction are causing environmental damage. Any increase in use WITHIN EXISTING LICENSED VOLUMES will increase the pressure on a system that is already failing environmental targets." 

Thread 1/2 https://t.co/1mnOuVTXt7

@CRTContactUs @UnaPaloma @CanalRiverTrust @Feargal_Sharkey @ChrisGPackham @LeeValleyPark @haringeycouncil @CanalRiverTrust are landowners of west bank, #Lock17 #HaleWharf & should work with @EnvAgency @thameswater @LeeValleyPark @wfcouncil @haringeycouncil to rescue this wild river& important biodiversity it supports @DefraWater @LDN_environment @LondonAssembly #StateOfNature

A busy night for the emergency services in Cornwall. 18 people evacuated from caravans at Notter Bridge & some residents asked to leave homes in Lostwithiel as a precaution. @CornwallFRS @MCA_media @EnvAgency @DC_Police https://t.co/ggv0oaQNUB

10 large woody debris features installed across Thornsgill Beck to slow the flow and push water onto the floodplain in storms. Excited to monitor the features to see impact on downstream flood peak. Partnership project with @ForestryEngland @EnvAgencyNW https://t.co/uzNrgbrda8
@DM_Wetlands @gideoncorby @Feargal_Sharkey @hackneycouncil @AECOM @WildLondon @mayorofhackney @jonburkeUK Great, and are the @EnvAgency and @CanalRiverTrust involved in drawing up the GI / NRN plan?
Why Is the @EnvAgency  doing nothing about these breaches? Why was the @ViridorUK Beddington Incinerator allowed to be built so close to people's homes and schools? #CleanAir https://t.co/YgUo6D61DU

Much improved forecast peak for #Hereford. River Wye remains elevated and our barriers will remain in place but a forecast of 4..5 - 4.8 this afternoon should see much less impacts than initially thought.  You can check #riverlevels here https://t.co/IuO6eGjUja #TeamEA https://t.co/GSdHrKjTeO

@gideoncorby @Feargal_Sharkey @hackneycouncil @AECOM @WildLondon @mayorofhackney @jonburkeUK We’ll be sending out a draft for comments and input late Jan... the actual canal water quality is a big issue and certainly needs EA and Canals and Rivers Trust involved

tweets.text: @Nick_Ely @DCfieldteamsEA @johncurtinEA @jamiemcclaughl1 @EnvAgencySW @MariaHerlihyEA @MoretonBack1 Hope all going well from North Norfolk ops

@mrfly @UnaPaloma @CanalRiverTrust @ChrisGPackham @LeeValleyPark @haringeycouncil @EnvAgency @thameswater @LDNWaterkeeper If you scroll down on this link you'll see a long list of reasons as to why, in the EA's opinion, that section of the Lee is failing to make 'Good' overall environmental health. It makes for grim reading.

https://t.co/ErPUO30qmr
@Nick_Ely @DCfieldteamsEA @johncurtinEA @jamiemcclaughl1 @EnvAgencySW @MariaHerlihyEA @MoretonBack1 Thank you. Is it all clear there now?

Today's #Christmas cracker: 

Give a 'dam' this Christmas...🎅

5 leaky dams have been installed on Crompton Moor in Oldham forming part of the mosaic of measures being trialled to test how nature based solutions can reduce risk of #flooding. 

@CityofTreesMcr 

#slowtheflow #nfm https://t.co/b0dw1U3wBD

tweets.text: Last week @NaturalEngland, @ForestryComm and @EnvAgency joined forces to stop damage to the River Lugg. Evidence was collected and is now being assessed . A legal investigation is  underway. Read more here: https://t.co/PL4IkhJtgo

tweets.text:
With heavy rain forecast into the weekend there's a risk of #flooding in parts of #Shropshire & #Herefordshire.

Our teams are getting prepared for #flood to keep communities safe. Are you prepared?

⚠️Please stay #FloodAware & check your flood risk here: https://t.co/4HSc5MbL20 https://t.co/9ls5vnQ8Mb
We have 8 flood warnings out across the South West including a new one for the River Exe #Exeter. Check if you're at risk and what to do to prepare for a flood: https://t.co/QdPKdEYx15

@EnvAgencyYNE @EnvAgency @SelbyDC @OliverHarmarEA @GavinUsherEA @GavinTabinerEA I would be a tad concerned if I lived in the selby area The #Persimmonhomes 
#StaynorHall 
The #RiverAireRenaissance is putting the river under under extreme strain #overdevelopment  
#Newland flood banks can't take the strain.

We've made temporary repairs to the flood defences at #Newland, near #Selby on the lower River #Aire, to ensure they are strengthened for winter. We'll be starting work to build a new #flood defence wall here next year: https://t.co/L4RRGXVy4k https://t.co/pQbVhmQZay

💧 Wetlands 💧 and 💧 flooding 💧

Could they be a natural safeguard against one of our biggest climate change risks? 

Find out more > https://t.co/nB1fk6tmmo

#NaturalFloodManagement #NaturalClimateSolutions #BlueRecovery https://t.co/FkJxDCkoRq

tweets.text: @ollie_yates @DCfieldteamsEA @johncurtinEA @jamiemcclaughl1 @EnvAgencySW @MariaHerlihyEA @MoretonBack1 Hi Ollie. Yes that's fine with me. Thanks Nick
@IwasOnlyThere @TheProspect1 @QuayPresents @TheQuayExeter We don’t expect the river to reach a level where the Exeter Quay defences are needed but we are monitoring the situation very closely.

Enjoyable visit to R. Chess today. Shocking to see road runoff #pollution but good discussions on planning a brighter future for #chalkstreams & the communities living alongside them. Thanks @TonyJuniper @AffinityWater @Chilternstreams @PJennings88 @CharlesWalkerMP @EnvAgency https://t.co/JKooSEhh8W

entity.name: Days of our Lives
entity.description: Set in the fictional Midwestern town of Salem, this long-running saga follows the lives, loves, triumphs and tragedies of the Horton, Brady, Kiriakis, Hernandez and DiMera families. Love stories, family troubles and suspenseful adventures embroil the denizens of Salem in every form of drama from flowering courtships, love triangles and unexpected wedding day reveals to custody battles, switched identities, murder investigations, lingering comas, mental illness, kidnappings, amnesia cases and more.

tweets.text: #TeamEA are working hard with partner organisations to return Black Potts Weir to full service following essential maintenance this winter. A great example of the @EnvAgency 's collaborative delivery framework in action! I look forward to my visit in January to see its progress. https://t.co/tEYNLabYdJ

Final adjustments to new reed bed created at Babb's Mill LNR #kingshurst @mhclg funded by #erdf will result in improved water quality and enhanced habitat for birds, fish & insects @Team4Nature @EnvAgency @LoveSolihull @SolihullCouncil @WKWT @WildlifeTrusts @Buzz_dont_tweet https://t.co/yjZl8yPVWP

Second gauging of the day for @EnvAgencySW . River Fowey@ Restormel. Approx 39 cumecs. One of the Crown Jewels of Devon and Cornwall gauges- there is a major abstraction supplying most of Cornwall’s drinking water, plus it lies upstream of Lostwithiel, so is key for #floodwarning https://t.co/fAH8040xcQ

tweets.text: A difficult night for many people evacuated from their homes due to flooding or threat of flooding last night particular in Notter Bridge & Lostwithiel. More on @BBCCornwall this morning https://t.co/fQLJcmerV2

We have issued a flood warning for the River Lynher in #Cornwall from Berriowbridge to Notter Bridge. Heavy rain in the area has caused river levels at Bastreet and Pillaton to rise rapidly and further rain is forecast. https://t.co/gC4fEyQc8p https://t.co/XJzYFuu04o

First in a new series of @ArchCentre talks: 
Designing for a Climate Emergency: Flood

Featuring @nicolabeech @Locallearning Dutch urban designer Edgar Kiviet from @ArupGroup and flood specialist Julie Foley from @EnvAgency 

Tickets now live!

https://t.co/3VNkv70mRB

tweets.text: @UnaPaloma @nickcarey @MeridianWater @thameswater @LeeValleyPark 5. An @envagency @CanalRiverTrust vegetation management programme to clear the overgrown willows blocking the #RiverLea Diversion channel to improve flow/ #waterquality #siltation & help knock back #schedule9 #INNS #floatingpennywort

A mile of the River Lugg has been bulldozed to destruction.
Bankside trees grubbed out & burnt.
Riverbed scraped out.
Meanders reprofiled.
Disaster for downstream wildlife.
This was an SSSI.
No consent was sought. 
@EnvAgency must surely prosecute this.
RT
https://t.co/cSBhrR2nDW

More fantastic work from our #StaffsSUNRISE project! Transforming the Trent into a more diverse and dynamic habitat for wildlife. 
@StaffsUni @EnvAgencyMids @WildTroutTrust @CraigBennett3 https://t.co/dP3LBMY7NU
Flooding on the River Lhyner up to houses in Rilla Mill, SE Cornwall this eve, worst in many years apparently @metoffice @EnvAgency @OfficialWXUK @BBCCornwall https://t.co/PQm4vgLWwc
@TheProspect1 @ExeterCouncil We don’t expect the river to reach a level where the Exeter Quay defences are needed, but we are monitoring the situation very closely.

sorry for a possible tricky one @HorshamDC but what enforcement powers, if any, do you have against @WeAreOpenreach for persistently littering this type of stuff on the pavement by their junction boxes, and I mean tens of thousands of these bits. (DM me if you want) https://t.co/Nwev8IW9gE

Allermoor Spillway stopped running early this morning, we had teams out first thing opening Monksleaze to operate the SOWY FRC at maximum capacity, this allows us to commence pumping at Langport stations until spillways start to run again. @EnvAgencySW https://t.co/IhBXnHPOu1

Yesterday, @NatResWales confirmed over 60% of the River Wye & its catchments fail against phosphate targets. These levels of pollution are unacceptable & we must ensure we start to reverse this. 

WEL members have put together this statement in response. https://t.co/gT5IidH7lB https://t.co/SLk2o1Lrx4
Keep an eye on our flood warnings page. New flood warnings issued in #Cornwall for River Fowey, River Torridge and River Kensey https://t.co/QdPKdEYx15 https://t.co/DVz04cN9lK
